title: With Soyuz off the table, OneWeb back in the mix
summary: OneWeb is considering American, European, Indian and Japanese rockets for launching its remaining 220 satellites after the company announced March 3 that it would stop using Russia’s Soyuz rocket.

title: Air Force Secretary: We’re worried about Russia but China is a bigger strategic threat
summary: Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall said, "when you look at it objectively, China is a much greater strategic threat than Russia is"

title: U.S. Air Force sees no impact from Russia’s decision to cut off supply of rocket engines
summary: Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall said U.S. national security launches will not be affected by Russia’s decision to stop supplying rocket engines to the United States.

title: NASA to Share Tools, Resources at Upcoming Agriculture Conference
summary: NASA will participate in the 2022 Commodity Classic conference, America’s largest farmer-led, farmer-focused educational and agricultural experience.

title: Kendall: Space ‘order of battle’ a top priority in U.S. defense budget and strategy
summary: Secretary of the Air Force Frank Kendall said the ‘space order of battle’ is driving budget discussions in preparation for the 2024 request.

summary: SpaceX confirms that its ninth launch of 2022 was a success, meaning that the company has now completed nine orbital launches in...

title: After another Starlink mission, SpaceX on pace for one launch per week this year
summary: Another batch of 47 internet satellites launched Thursday on a Falcon 9 rocket from Kennedy Space Center, heading into the sky to join SpaceX’s Starlink broadband network on the company’s ninth mission in nine weeks, keeping pace with a goal of around 50 Falcon flights this year.

title: The US Space Force plans to start patrolling the area around the Moon
summary: "Until now, the United States space mission extended 22,000 miles above Earth."
